page.title: 16Housing around Water
page.content: Much of the housing is stone built terraces with purple slate roofs approximately 100 years old. There are many detail differences but the commonest house is made from blocks of rough faced stone about 38cm long by 18cm high, laid in neat courses. Usually there are two large windows at the front,about 115cm by 180cm, one on each storey, with painted wooden frames. The door is wood, sometimes with a pane of glass to allow more light. Some houses have had the stone cleaned by sandblasting, on the others is the black stain of pollution. The mortar on these is picked out by a light colour. A terraced house has three rooms downstairs and a hall and stairs,with two bedrooms upstairs and a bathroom.
